Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Misunderstand \Mis*un`der*stand"\ (m[i^]s*[u^]n`d[~e]r*st[a^]nd"), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Misunderstood} (m[i^]s*[u^]n`d[~e]r*st[oo^]d"); p. pr. & vb. n. {Misunderstanding}.] To misconceive; to mistake; to miscomprehend; to take in a wrong sense. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Misunderstanding \Mis*un`der*stand"ing\, n. 1. Mistake of the meaning; error; misconception. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
2. Disagreement; difference of opinion; dissension; quarrel. ``Misunderstandings among friends.'' --Swift. [1913 Webster]

misunderstanding n 1: putting the wrong interpretation on; "his misinterpretation of the question caused his error"; "there was no mistaking her meaning" [syn: {misinterpretation}, {mistaking}] 2: an understanding of something that is not correct; "he wasn't going to admit his mistake"; "make no mistake about his intentions"; "there must be some misunderstanding--I don't have a sister" [syn: {mistake}, {misapprehension}]
